intro: Psychotria carronis, commonly known as the Caribbean psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as tropical rainforests. Psychotria carronis is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
